column4: hi, i'm using jaunty with kde. when i login, dcopserver isn't running and i'm not able to use dcopstart. any ideas?
delete the ~/.DCOP blah blah files and reboot
if you can't log on, boot to recovery root console and do it there
ls -a   will show you the files
actually i'm able to login. but i'm not able to start konsole with my preconfigured set of tabs using dcopstart. will try deleting DCOP :) thanks :)
well, i tried what you said, still i'm getting "Error: Could not find service 'konsole-script'." if i run "dcopstart konsole-start"
yup, but not many suggestions or solutions. am still searching :)
let me see what i can dig up
if i just run "dcop" it gives the list of kde programs running just fine. only dcopstart for konsole-script fails
have you put a script in ~/.kde/Autostart  to autorun at login?
nope. my dcopstart commands are in a script which i run manually.
this is a plain vanilla install :)
hmm, seems there is this: /usr/lib/kde4/share/kde4/services/konsole-script.desktop   which is interesting
do you have that file? what does it run?
hmm i don't have that file. which package provides that file?
couldnt tell you dude, try just running: konsole-script   you may find, command-not-found will tell you
